verses.roman:
gauḍiyā--'bāṭapāḍa' nahe, tumi--'bāṭapāḍa'
tīrtha-vāsī luṭha', āra cāha' māribāra

synonyms: gauḍiyā—the Bengalis; bāṭapāḍa nahe—are not rogues; tumi—you; bāṭapāḍa—rogues; tīrtha-vāsī—persons visiting places of pilgrimage; luṭha'-you plunder; āra—and; cāha'-you want; māribāra—to kill.
translation: "The Bengali pilgrims are not rogues. You are rogues, for you want to kill the pilgrims and plunder them."
